This involves:

1. First, identify all git branches in the repository
2. For each branch:
 - Check out the branch
 - Locate all project files that specify C# language version
 - Update the `<LangVersion>` property from "10" or "10.0" to "12" or "12.0"
 - Build the project to verify no compilation errors occur
 - Only if the build succeeds: commit the changes with a descriptive message like "Update C# language version from 10 to 12"
 - Only if the build succeeds: push the committed changes to the remote repository
 - If the build fails: revert all changes and report the failure

3. Provide a summary of which branches were successfully updated and which (if any) failed

Important: Do not commit or push any changes if the build fails. Always verify the build passes before making any commits. This involves:

1. First, identify all git branches in the repository
2. For each branch:
 - Check out the branch
 - Locate all project files that specify C# language version
 - Update the `<LangVersion>` property from "10" or "10.0" to "12" or "12.0"
 - Build the project to verify no compilation errors occur
 - Only if the build succeeds: commit the changes with a descriptive message like "Update C# language version from 10 to 12"
 - Only if the build succeeds: push the committed changes to the remote repository
 - If the build fails: revert all changes and report the failure

3. Provide a summary of which branches were successfully updated and which (if any) failed

Important: Do not commit or push any changes if the build fails. Always verify the build passes before making any commits. Now let me create a comprehensive plan:

## Plan for Updating C# Language Version from 10 to 12 Across All Branches

Based on my analysis, here's my detailed plan:

**Identified Branches:**
- main (current)
- 1.0-in-class
- 1.0-inclass-solution 
- 1.0.0-throwing-exceptions
- 1.0.1-throwing-exceptions
- 1.1.0-using-nullable
- 1.2.0-using-result
- 1.2.1-using-result-improve-testing
- 1.3.0-using-try-cache-system.exception
- 1.3.1-using-exception-handling-service
- 2.0-inclass
- 2.0-inclass-solution

**For each branch, I will:**

1. **Check out the branch**
2. **Find all project files** (.csproj, .fsproj, .vbproj) in the branch
3. **Search for LangVersion properties** set to "10" or "10.0"
4. **Update LangVersion properties** from "10"/"10.0" to "12"/"12.0"
5. **If no LangVersion property exists but we want to ensure C# 12**, add `<LangVersion>12</LangVersion>` to the PropertyGroup
6. **Build the project** to verify compilation succeeds
7. **If build succeeds**: commit changes with message "Update C# language version from 10 to 12"
8. **If build succeeds**: push changes to remote
9. **If build fails**: revert all changes and report the failure

**Files to potentially modify:**
- Any .csproj, .fsproj, or .vbproj files found in each branch

Let me proceed with this plan. I'll start by checking each branch systematically.

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "update_csharp_version.ps1", "file_content": "# PowerShell script to update C# language version from 10 to 12 across all branches\n\n$branches = @(\n \"main\",\n \"1.0-in-class\",\n \"1.0-inclass-solution\",\n \"1.0.0-throwing-exceptions\", \n \"1.0.1-throwing-exceptions\",\n \"1.1.0-using-nullable\",\n \"1.2.0-using-result\",\n \"1.2.1-using-result-improve-testing\",\n \"1.3.0-using-try-cache-system.exception\",\n \"1.3.1-using-exception-handling-service\",\n \"2.0-inclass\",\n \"2.0-inclass-solution\"\n)\n\n$successfulBranches = @()\n$failedBranches = @()\n\nforeach ($branch in $branches) {\n Write-Host \"Processing branch: $branch\" -ForegroundColor Yellow\n \n # Checkout branch\n git checkout $branch\n if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {\n Write-Host \"Failed to checkout branch $branch\" -ForegroundColor Red\n $failedBranches += \"$branch (checkout failed)\"\n continue\n }\n \n # Find all project files\n $projectFiles = Get-ChildItem -Recurse -Include \"*.csproj\", \"*.fsproj\", \"*.vbproj\"\n \n if ($projectFiles.Count -eq 0) {\n Write-Host \"No project files found in branch $branch\" -ForegroundColor Yellow\n continue\n }\n \n $filesModified = $false\n \n foreach ($projectFile in $projectFiles) {\n Write-Host \"Checking project file: $($projectFile.FullName)\" -ForegroundColor Cyan\n \n $content = Get-Content $projectFile.FullName -Raw\n $originalContent = $content\n \n # Check if LangVersion is set to 10 or 10.0 and update to 12\n if ($content -match '<LangVersion>\\s*10(\\.0)?\\s*</LangVersion>') {\n $content = $content -replace '<LangVersion>\\s*10(\\.0)?\\s*</LangVersion>', '<LangVersion>12</LangVersion>'\n $filesModified = $true\n Write-Host \"Updated LangVersion from 10 to 12 in $($projectFile.Name)\" -ForegroundColor Green\n }\n # If no LangVersion property exists, add it to ensure C# 12\n elseif ($content -notmatch '<LangVersion>') {\n # Find PropertyGroup and add LangVersion\n if ($content -match '(\\s*)<PropertyGroup>') {\n $indent = $matches[1]\n $content = $content -replace '(\\s*<PropertyGroup>\\s*\\n)', \"`$1$indent <LangVersion>12</LangVersion>`n\"\n $filesModified = $true\n Write-Host \"Added LangVersion 12 to $($projectFile.Name)\" -ForegroundColor Green\n }\n }\n \n if ($content -ne $originalContent) {\n Set-Content $projectFile.FullName -Value $content -NoNewline\n }\n }\n \n if ($filesModified) {\n # Try to build the project\n Write-Host \"Building project to verify changes...\" -ForegroundColor Cyan\n dotnet build\n \n if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {\n Write-Host \"Build successful! Committing changes...\" -ForegroundColor Green\n \n # Commit changes\n git add .\n git commit -m \"Update C# language version from 10 to 12\"\n \n if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {\n # Push changes\n git push origin $branch\n \n if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {\n Write-Host \"Successfully updated and pushed branch $branch\" -ForegroundColor Green\n $successfulBranches += $branch\n } else {\n Write-Host \"Failed to push branch $branch\" -ForegroundColor Red\n $failedBranches += \"$branch (push failed)\"\n }\n } else {\n Write-Host \"Failed to commit changes for branch $branch\" -ForegroundColor Red\n $failedBranches += \"$branch (commit failed)\"\n }\n } else {\n Write-Host \"Build failed for branch $branch. Reverting changes...\" -ForegroundColor Red\n git checkout .\n $failedBranches += \"$branch (build failed)\"\n }\n } else {\n Write-Host \"No changes needed for branch $branch\" -ForegroundColor Yellow\n $successfulBranches += \"$branch (no changes needed)\"\n }\n}\n\n# Summary\nWrite-Host \"`n=== SUMMARY ===\" -ForegroundColor Magenta\nWrite-Host \"Successful branches:\" -ForegroundColor Green\nforeach ($branch in $successfulBranches) {\n Write-Host \" - $branch\" -ForegroundColor Green\n}\n\nif ($failedBranches.Count -gt 0) {\n Write-Host \"`nFailed branches:\" -ForegroundColor Red\n foreach ($branch in $failedBranches) {\n Write-Host \" - $branch\" -ForegroundColor Red\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Now let me start processing each branch. This involves:

1. Check out each branch individually
2. Locate the .gitignore file in the repository root
3. Add or update the .gitignore entries to exclude the complete .idea directory and all its contents by adding:
 ```
 # JetBrains IDEs (IntelliJ, WebStorm, PhpStorm, etc.)
 .idea/
 ```
4. If .idea/ is already present in .gitignore, ensure it's properly configured to ignore the entire directory
5. Remove any existing .idea files/folders that are already tracked in git using `git rm -r --cached .idea/` (if they exist)
6. Build the project to verify no issues were introduced
7. Only if the build succeeds: commit the changes with message "Add .idea/ to .gitignore to exclude JetBrains IDE files"
8. Only if the build succeeds: push the committed changes to the remote repository
9. If the build fails: revert all changes and report the failure
